meanings.def: a type of literature that describes imaginary people and events, not real ones
examples: She has written novels and short fiction.
a well-known writer of crime fiction
She has written over 20 works of fiction.

meanings.def: a thing that is invented or imagined and is not true
examples: Don't believe what she says—it's pure fiction!
fiction that… For years he managed to keep up the fiction that he was not married.
She still tries to maintain the fiction that she is happily married.
Fact and fiction became all jumbled up in his report of the robbery.

meanings.def: used to say that things that actually happen are often more surprising than stories that are invented

idioms.def: used to say that things that actually happen are often more surprising than stories that are invented
